text: Yes! We actually a boilerplate to help you get started with this <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react-boilerplate>

Awesome, thank you <@UFBNA9K9A>! And is this fully compatible with the HUBL fields integration (As an example... I could make a "Hero" banner module, with fields for background image and heading text?)

Based on the boilerplate, I assume all modules would go into `/src/modules/module-name/` ?
I’ll be honest, I haven’t done this myself so I’m not 100% sure, however that sounds right

Similarly if you prefer :vuejs:  we have a vue boilerplate: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-vue-boilerplate>

We wrote up some advice on how to use javascript frameworks on HubSpot here:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/js-frameworks>

We definitely want feedback on the experience working with these frameworks on HubSpot, both from a “things you wish you’d known” and a “hey this doesn’t work as well as I wanted, or I wish this feature existed” standpoint.

Any questions or suggestions are best thrown into
<#CM9UXHWKH|js-frameworks-in-HubSpot-cms>
As far as using the boilerplate, yes you would add your modules to that modules folder. I suggest looking at the example module to learn how it was set up.
Brilliant, okay, thank you both! <@UFBNA9K9A> <@U7SL518D6> Will dive in here a little more today. Appreciate the help!
Glad to know it's at least possible :+1::skin-tone-4::sunglasses:
A way to make client-side http requests? I think I've seen a HubSpot resource that helps but I can't find it.
Can I use something like axios for these kinds of API calls?
